title: make_reference
description: Build a transcriptomics reference into one of many formats.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the reference
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the reference.

genome_fasta.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/GRCh38.primary_assembly.genome.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta
genome_fasta.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/GRCh38.primary_assembly.genome.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta.

transcriptome_gtf.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/gencode.v41.annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference transcriptome annotation
transcriptome_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/gencode.v41.annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference transcriptome annotation.

ercc.description: Type: `file`, example: `https://assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/ERCC92.zip`. ERCC sequence and annotation file
ercc.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `https://assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/ERCC92.zip`. ERCC sequence and annotation file.

target.description: Type: List of `string`, default: `star`, multiple_sep: `":"`, choices: ``cellranger`, `bd_rhapsody`, `star``. Which reference indices to generate
target.help_text: Type: List of `string`, default: `star`, multiple_sep: `":"`, choices: ``cellranger`, `bd_rhapsody`, `star``. Which reference indices to generate.

output_fasta.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_fasta.gz`, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Output genome sequence fasta
output_fasta.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_fasta.gz`, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Output genome sequence fasta.

output_gtf.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Output transcriptome annotation gtf
output_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Output transcriptome annotation gtf.

subset_regex.description: Type: `string`, example: `(ERCC-00002|chr1)`. Will subset the reference chromosomes using the given regex
subset_regex.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `(ERCC-00002|chr1)`. Will subset the reference chromosomes using the given regex.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
